item.name: Expense Templates

header.description: The protocol version between a REST client and service. If the client does not specify this header in the request the server will pick a default version for the API.

For example: Metadata-Context:sandbox="TrackEmployeeFeature".

variable.description: (Required) Value that uniquely identifies an expense template.

query.description: When this parameter is provided, the specified children are included in the resource payload (instead of just a link). The value of this query parameter is "all" or "". More than one child can be specified using comma as a separator. Example: ?expand=Employees,Localizations. Nested children can also be provided following the format "Child.NestedChild" (Example: ?expand=Employees.Managers). If a nested child is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?expand=Employees.Managers" is the same as "?expand=Employees,Employees.Managers" (which will expand Employees and Managers).

This parameter filters the resource fields. Only the specified fields are returned, which means that if no fields are specified, no fields are returned (useful to get only the links). If an indirect child resource is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?fields=Employees.Managers:Empname" is the same as "?fields=;Employees:;Employees.Managers:Empname" (which will only return the "Empname" field for Managers). the value of this query parameter is a list of resource fields. The attribute can be a direct (Example: Employees) or indirect (Example: Employees.Managers) child. It cannot be combined with expand query parameter. If both are provided, only fields will be considered.

Format: ?fields=Attribute1,Attribute2

Format for fields in child resource: ?fields=Accessor1:Attribute1,Attribute2
The resource item payload will be filtered in order to contain only data (no links section, for example).

This parameter specifies dependencies which are fields that are set before and rolled back after generating the response. Generally they are used to preview the effects of an attribute change. The fields specified in this parameter are always set in the resource instance in question. When a child resource collection is requested and the parameter is set, the fields will be set in the parent resource instance before generating the resource collection payload. The value of this query parameter is a set of dependency fields. Example: dependency=ProductId=2

This parameter restricts the number of resources returned inside the resource collection. If the limit exceeds the resource count then the framework will only return the available resources.
Used to define the starting position of the resource collection. If offset exceeds the resource count then no resources are returned. Default value is 0.
The resource collection representation will include the "estimated row count" when "?totalResults=true", otherwise the count is not included.  The default value is "false".

This query parameter defines the where clause. The resource collection will be queried using the provided expressions. The value of this query parameter is one or more expressions. Example: ?q=Deptno>=10 and <= 30;Loc!=NY

Format: ?q=expression1;expression2

You can use these queryable attributes to filter this collection resource using the q query parameter:
  • AllowRcptMissingFlag; boolean; Indicates whether individuals can submit expense reports with receipts missing.
  • BusinessUnit; string; Name of a person's business unit.
  • CashReceiptRequiredFlag; boolean; Indicates whether receipts are required for cash expenses above a specified amount.
  • CashReceiptRequiredLimit; number; Amount limit, above which a cash expense requires a receipt.
  • CcReceiptRequiredFlag; boolean; Indicates whether receipts are required for corporate card expenses above a specified limit.
  • CcReceiptRequiredLimit; number; Amount limit, above which a corporate card expense requires a receipt.
  • CreatedBy; string; User who created the expense template.
  • CreationDate; string; Date when an expense template was created.
  • Description; string; Description of an expense template.
  • DescriptionBehaviour; string; Behavior of the expense item Description field, which is defined at the expense type level.
  • DescriptionBehaviourCode; string; Code associated with the description behavior.
  • DfltCcExpTypeId; integer; Value that uniquely identifies an expense type that is assigned to a credit card transaction if an expense type mapping has not been defined.
  • DispRcptViolationFlag; boolean; Indicates whether a missing receipt policy warning is displayed to the user.
  • EnableCcMappingFlag; boolean; Indicates whether the lookup codes from the charge file are associated with the company's expense types.
  • ExpenseTemplateId; integer; Value that uniquely identifies an expense template.
  • InactiveDate; string; Date when the expense type can no longer be used.
  • LastUpdateDate; string; Date when the expense template was last updated.
  • LastUpdateLogin; string; Session login that is associated with the user who last updated the expense template.
  • LastUpdatedBy; string; User who last updated the expense template.
  • LocationBehaviour; string; Behavior of the Expense Location field, which is defined at the expense type level.
  • LocationBehaviourCode; string; Code that is associated with the expense location behavior.
  • MerchantBehaviour; string; Behavior of the Merchant field, which is defined at the expense type level.
  • MerchantBehaviourCode; string; Code that is associated with the merchant behavior.
  • Name; string; Name of the expense template.
  • NegativeRcptRequiredFlag; boolean; Indicates whether the receipt requirement rules are applied to negative expense lines.
  • NumberOfDaysBehaviour; string; Behavior of the Number of Days field, which is defined at the expense type level.
  • NumberOfDaysBehaviourCode; string; Code that is associated with the number of days behavior.
  • OrgId; integer; Value that uniquely identifies the business unit associated with a row.
  • StartDate; string; Date when an expense type is available for use in expense reports.

This parameter orders a resource collection based on the specified fields.  The parameter value is a comma-separated string of attribute names, each optionally followed by a colon and "asc" or "desc".  Specify "asc" for ascending and "desc" for descending. The default value is "asc".  For example, ?orderBy=field1:asc,field2:desc

Used as a predefined finder to search the collection.

Format: ?finder=<finderName>;<variableName>=<variableValue>,<variableName2>=<variableValue2>

The following are the available finder names and corresponding finder variables:

  • PrimaryKey: Finds an expense template using an expense template identifier that matches the primary key criteria specified.
    Finder Variables:
    • ExpenseTemplateId; integer; Identifier of an expense template.
  • findByOrgIdAndDate: Finds all expense templates using a given organization identifier and date.
    Finder Variables:
    • bindDate; string; Expense templates found for a given date that are less than or equal to the inactive date.
    • bindOrgId; integer; Expense templates found for a given organization identifier.

You can use these queryable attributes to filter this collection resource using the q query parameter:
  • BUId; integer; Value that uniquely identifies a business unit associated with a row.
  • CodeCombinationId; integer; Value that uniquely identifies the general ledger account for an expense type.
  • Currency; string; Name of a country's currency.
  • CurrencyCode; string; Code that is associated with a country's currency.
  • EnableProjectsFlag; boolean; Indicates whether an expense type can be charged to projects.
  • EndDate; string; Date when an expense template can no longer be used.
  • ExpenseCategory; string; Expense category that is assigned to an expense item.
  • ExpenseCategoryCode; string; Code that is associated with an expense category.
  • ExpenseTemplateId; integer; Value that uniquely identifies an expense template that contains an expense type.
  • ExpenseTypeId; integer; Value that uniquely identifies an expense type in an expense template.
  • ExpenseTypeName; string; Name of an expense type as appears in the expense report.
  • ItemizationBehaviour; string; Itemization behavior of an expense type, whether enabled, disabled, or required.
  • ItemizationBehaviourCode; string; Code that is associated with itemization behavior.
  • ItemizationOnlyFlag; boolean; Indicates whether an expense type is only used for itemization.
  • JustificationAmount; number; Maximum amount per expense category that can be paid by cash, above which a justification of the amount is required.
  • PersonId; integer; Value that uniquely identifies the person who incurred an expense.
  • ProjectReceiptRequiredFlag; boolean; Indicates whether an expense type can be charged to projects and whether a receipt is required for a project-enabled expense type.
  • ReceiptRequiredCode; string; Code that is associated with a type of required receipt, such as Original, Imaged, or Both.
  • ReceiptRequiredFlag; boolean; Indicates whether receipts are required for expenses.
  • ReceiptThresholdAmount; number; Maximum amount per expense category that can be paid without expense receipts.
  • StartDate; string; Date when an expense template is available for use in expense reports.
  • TaxClassification; string; Default tax code that is assigned to an expense item.
  • TaxClassificationCode; string; Code that is associated with a tax classification.
  • TopLevelExpenseTypeFlag; boolean; Indicates whether itemization is enabled, disabled, or required for an expense type.
